metadata.title: CVE-2022-25375 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/usb/gadget/function/rndis.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.16.10. The RNDIS USB gadget lacks validation of the size ofthe RNDIS_MSG_SET command. Attackers can obtain sensitive information fromkernel memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25375` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-lowlatency - 4.4.0-230.264
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
